lead_paragraph: Dr. Bell was a key voice in limiting medical school graduates’ workloads after an 18-year-old’s death at a Manhattan hospital in 1984 led to calls for reform.

headline.print_headline: Bertrand M. Bell, Who Strove to Limit Medical Trainees’ Hours, Dies at 86
headline.main: Bertrand M. Bell, Who Strove to Reduce Medical Trainees’ Grueling Shifts, Dies at 86

snippet: Dr. Bell was a key voice in limiting medical school graduates’ workloads after an 18-year-old’s death at a Manhattan hospital in 1984 led to calls for reform....
abstract: Dr Bertrand M Bell, physician whose greatest legacy involved successful campaign to reform grueling training schedules of interns and residents in America's hospitals that had been exposing staff and patients to fallout from exhaustion, dies at age 86.
